command: [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = [Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12; $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $domain='example.com'; $out='C:\ProgramData\recon\shodan_search_example.com.json'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Force -Path C:\ProgramData\recon | Out-Null; $log='C:\ProgramData\recon\recon.log'; try { $key=$env:SHODAN_API_KEY; if([string]::IsNullOrWhiteSpace($key)){ throw 'SHODAN_API_KEY not set'; } $q="hostname:$domain"; $uri="https://api.shodan.io/shodan/host/search?key=$key&query=$([Uri]::EscapeDataString($q))"; $resp=Invoke-WebRequest -Uri $uri -Method Get -UseBasicParsing -TimeoutSec 45 -ErrorAction Stop; if(($resp.StatusCode -ge 200) -and ($resp.StatusCode -lt 300) -and ($resp.Headers['Content-Type'] -match 'application/json')){ ($resp.Content | ConvertFrom-Json) | ConvertTo-Json -Depth 6 | Set-Content -Path $out -Encoding UTF8 } else { Add-Content -Path $log -Value "$(Get-Date -Format o) Shodan non-success or non-JSON for $domain. Status=$($resp.StatusCode)" } } catch { Add-Content -Path $log -Value "$(Get-Date -Format o) Shodan error for $domain: $($_.Exception.Message)" }
explanation: Queries Shodan’s paid API for hosts matching the target domain, a closed-source search provider, and saves results in structured JSON.
rationale_steps: Authenticate to Shodan with an API key stored securely as an environment variable.
Execute a constrained query to avoid noisy results.
Validate and parse JSON response, writing to disk.
Log failure conditions without exposing the query key.
